Package ohos.hiviewdfx

Class ResourceTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.hiviewdfx.ResourceTag

  • public class ResourceTag
extends Object
    Represents a resource tag, which helps mark resources to avoid the situation where resources are not released as supposed or are not released in a timely manner.

    This tag is attached upon resource requests and detached upon resource release. If resources are supposed to be released but actually not released, a caution is generated.

    For example, if an object is reclaimed by a virtual machine (VM) but its resources are not released, the corresponding caution is generated.

    Sample code for using ResourceTag: 

     public class XxxResource {
     private final ResourceTag resTag = ResourceTag.get();
     private final String TAG_MSG = "XxxResource opened by the get method, but not closed by the close method";

     public void get() {
         ...;
         resTag.markInUse(TAG_MSG);
     }

     public void close() {
         resTag.release();
         ...;
     }

     protected void finalize() {
         resTag.warnIfNeed();
         ...;
     }
 }
    Since:
    5
    See Also:
    Rule#CHECK_VM_RELEASE_MISS

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static ResourceTag get​()
        Obtains a new ResourceTag object.

        To use the resource tag mechanism for resources, you need to call this method and attach the obtained resource tag to resources via markInUse(java.lang.String).

        Returns:
        Returns the obtained ResourceTag object.
        Since:
        5

      • markInUse

        public void markInUse​(String resourceTag)
        Marks a resource tag as in use so that it is attached to the paired resource.
        Parameters:
        resourceTag - Indicates the custom resource description, which is used to notify you of details about the resource not correctly released. The following format is recommended: Resources are requested by the xxx class name#open() method and need to be closed by the xxx class name#close() method
        Since:
        5

      • release

        public void release​()
        Releases a resource tag so that it is detached from the paired resource.

        If the resource tag is released, resources attached to the tag will also be closed or released.

        Since:
        5

      • warnIfNeed

        public void warnIfNeed​()
        Determines whether to generate a caution based on the resource tag state.

        If the resource tag is in use and the detection rule Rule.VM_CHECK_RESOUCE_LEAK was added for your application, calling this method will generate a caution unless you have called the release() method.

        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        Rule#CHECK_VM_RELEASE_MISS
